data.title: Food Bites: Wingstock, Tontitown Grape Festival & More
data.meta_description: We have no shortage of food bites throughout Arkansas, so each week, we’ll be providing you with a snapshot of the goings-on inside the
data.text:
We have no shortage of food bites throughout Arkansas, so each week, we’ll be providing you with a snapshot of the goings-on inside the culinary world, from events and specials to restaurant openings and awards. Do you have news to share? Please email our online editor, Kilee Hall, at khall@aymag.com.

Wingstock, the annual chicken wing festival presented by the Poultry Federation, will be held Saturday, Aug. 10, at Simmons Bank Arena in North Little Rock. Click here for more information.

The Hope Watermelon Festival, taking place from Aug. 8 through Aug. 10, will feature multi-award-winning country artist Rodney Atkins as this year’s headliner. Click here for all the details!

Waldo’s Chicken & Beer officially opened its newest Little Rock location in Breckenridge Village. Click here for more details.

Lasang Pinoy, a new Filipino restaurant, opens on Thursday, Aug. 8, at 200 N. 1st Street in Rogers for a limited time. According to its website, the pop-up restaurant will use this space through October until repairs are completed at its permanent location.

Copper Mule Table and Tap officially closed the doors of its Little Rock location after less than a year of operations. Click here to learn more.

Community Bakery recently revealed plans for a third location in west Little Rock at 11121 N. Rodney Parham Rd., Suite 14A. Click here for more details.

The Tontitown Grape Festival is currently ongoing through Saturday, Aug. 10, for its 125th year. Click here for more information.

The Meteor will open its new South Yard location on Friday, Aug. 9, in Fayetteville.

Mockingbird Bar and Tacos recently announced the restaurant is now officially owned and operated by Mason Jonah Bean.

7 Brew Coffee and Scooter’s Coffee, are expanding their presence in Conway with new shops on East Oak Street. Click here for more details.

Table Mesa Bistro will be moving its bakery and market to 628 W. Lancashire Blvd. in Bella Vista.

Cajun Boilers, located at 2806 Albert Pike Rd. in Hot Springs, set a Sept. 26 grand opening date under new ownership. Click here for more information.

The 77th Annual Mt. Nebo Chicken Fry will take place on Saturday, Aug. 17, at Mount Nebo State Park. This year’s event is themed “Chicken, Pickin, and Politickin.” Click here for more details.

Purple Cow, located at 8026 Cantrell Rd. in Little Rock, will reopen in early September after the building was damaged from the March 31, 2023, tornadoes.

Onyx Coffee Lab, a café and roastery with several locations in Northwest Arkansas, recently received the highest certification from Living Wage for US, making it the first-ever business in Arkansas to be recognized for paying its employees a livable wage.

Hideaway Pizza is set to open another Arkansas location on the south side of Chenal Parkway at Kanis Road in Little Rock.

Chipotle Mexican Grill will open a new location inside the former Tacos 4 Life space at 3113 E. Race Avenue in Searcy.

Sunny’s Stir Fry, an authentic Chinese restaurant, recently opened at 2335 N. College Ave. in Fayetteville.

AQ Chicken House, a beloved landmark in Springdale, has taken a major step toward its revival. Click here for all the details.

Mr Brews Taphouse, a gourmet burger and craft beer restaurant, is slated to open its first Arkansas location later this year. Click here for all the details.

HarvestFest in Hillcrest will return on Oct. 12 for its 30th year with many local food vendors. Click here for more information.

The Great Southern Mac & Cheese Championship will take place on Sunday, Sept. 29, from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. at Argenta Plaza. Click here for more information.

Origami Sake has announced that The American Craft Sake Festival will make its return to Hot Springs on Saturday, April 12, 2025.

David’s Burgers will be opening a new location in Searcy. The restaurant is anticipated to open in mid-November.

Chuy’s is opening a new location in Conway. It’s expected to open sometime during the first half of next year.

DeLuca’s Pizza will join Dave Portnoy’s One Bite Pizza Festival in New York City later this year! Click here for more details.

The Downtown Food Truck Festival, formerly known as the Main Street Food Truck Festival, will take place on Sunday, Sept. 22, at a new location. Click here for more information.

Flaming Hot Pot & Korean BBQ will be opening a new location at 310 Shackleford Rd. in Little Rock. Click here for all the details.

Shorty Small’s, a longtime favorite restaurant to many central Arkansans, will be opening a new location in Beebe. Click here for more details.

Five Guys recently opened a new location at 1229 W. Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd. in Fayetteville.

The Croissanterie officially opened its new location in downtown Little Rock on Monday, Aug. 5! Click here for more details.
